column1: • Hero : Kazmir went seven innings and allowed only two runners to reach second base . 	 • Figure this : Just 16 days after setting a franchise record with 13 strikeouts in a game
column2: Kazmir whiffed 10 or more for the 12th time in his career . 	 • Quotable : " They threw a different lineup out there
column3: took away a lot of the lefties . It was nice to see Big Papi out of the lineup . " --   Kazmir 	 -- ESPN.com news services 	 Devil Rays 1
column4: Red Sox 0 	 BOSTON ( AP ) -- Scott Kazmir was so sharp even Manny Ramirez and David Ortiz might have had trouble hitting him . 	 With Boston 's two sluggers out of the lineup in the same game for the first time this season
column5: Tampa Bay 's ace struck out 10 and scattered five singles in seven innings in a 1 - 0 win over the Red Sox on Monday night . 	 " They threw a different lineup out there
column6: took away a lot of the lefties
column8: who let just two runners reach second base . " It was nice to see Big Papi out of the lineup . " 	 The Devil Rays ' left - hander has been sharp against both power hitters . Ramirez is batting .154 against him ( 6 - for-39 ) and Ortiz is hitting .147 ( 5 - for-34 ) . Ramirez
column10: missed his 13th straight game with a strained muscle in his left side . Ortiz
column12: has a sore right knee and taking a night off against his nemesis made sense
column13: although he grounded out as a pinch hitter in the ninth against Al Reyes . 	 But they can change the game with one swing . 	 Dustin Pedroia
column15: was retired three times with one out -- twice with runners at second and once with a man at first . Mike Lowell
column18: ending three innings by striking out and leaving a runner at second in the first and eighth . 	 Right fielder J.D. Drew
column20: also sat out . 	 " Other than that
column22: " Coco Crisp said . Kazmir " is good pretty much all the time . " 	 In nine career starts in Boston
column23: he 's 4 - 3 with a 2.73 ERA and 59 strikeouts in 52 2/3 innings . On July 29
column24: he blanked the Red Sox here before coming out after six innings . On Monday
column25: he threw a season - high 118 pitches . 	 Curt Schilling ( 8 - 7 ) struck out five and allowed one run
column26: five hits and a walk in six innings . 	 Greg Norton led off the fifth with a double
column27: took third on Dioner Navarro 's sacrifice and scored on Josh Wilson 's sacrifice fly . 	 " We have to play fundamental baseball and we were able to do that
column28: " Norton said . " We were able to come out with a 1 - 0 victory
column29: which does n't happen too often in Boston . " 	 The last time the Red Sox lost 1 - 0 at home was on Sept. 2
column31: when the New York Yankees ' Mike Mussina lost a perfect game with two outs in the ninth . 	 " I was in a position to get a strikeout against Wilson
column32: " Schilling said . " I probably should have made a pitch [ catcher Jason Varitek ] wanted originally . " 	 The game " was well pitched on both sides
column33: " Tampa Bay manager Joe Maddon said . " It really had that playoff kind of atmosphere . " 	 Maddon used that to motivate Kazmir when he visited the mound after the lefty walked Varitek to put runners at first and second with one out in the seventh . 	 " I said
column34: ' This is not a normal game . This is a playoff game . ' That 's what I whispered in his ear
column35: " Maddon said . " I wanted him to get used to this stuff . " 	 Kazmir then struck out Jacoby Ellsbury and retired Alex Cora on a forceout at third . 	 " It pumped me up
column36: " Kazmir said . " I was going on adrenaline to begin with
column37: but that intensified it . " 	 Tampa Bay is 13 - 4 in its last 17 games but is in last place in the AL East . Boston is 7 - 3 in its last 10 games
column38: but its lead in the division dropped to five games over the Yankees
column39: who were idle . 	 Just sixteen days after setting a franchise record with 13 strikeouts
column40: Kazmir fanned at least 10 for the fourth time this season and 12th in his career . When he struck out Crisp in the first after a leadoff single by Julio Lugo
column41: Kazmir became the eighth active pitcher to record 200 strikeouts in a season by the age of 23 . 	 Besides Lugo
column42: who advanced on a two - out wild pitch
column43: the only Boston runner to reach second against him was Bobby Kielty on a leadoff single in the seventh and a one - out walk to Varitek . 	 " He had electric stuff
column44: " Varitek said 	 Dan Wheeler pitched the eighth and Reyes got his 24th save in 26 chances with a perfect ninth . 	 Kazmir allowed the leadoff batter to reach base in five of his seven innings and retired the side in order just once
column46: one of the five innings in which he recorded two strikeouts . 	 Game notes 	  Ellsbury has hit safely in all 10 games since being recalled on Sept. 1 . He singled in the third inning . ... Of the eight active pitchers with 200 strikeouts in a season by the age of 23

column49: second most for Tampa Bay . ... Kazmir 's 16 starts against Boston are the most he 's made against any team . ... Lowell is in a 3 - for-27 slump that lowered his batting average to .321 . ... Boston RHP Mike Timlin pitched in his 1

column1: • Turning point : Curtis Granderson hit a two - run single after Roy Halladay was relieved with two outs in the bottom on the ninth to bring Detroit within a run . 	 • Hunt for October : With the win
column2: Detroit climbed within 3½ games of the idle Yankees in the AL wild - card race . 	 • Work horse : Halladay
column4: has lasted at least eight innings in his last six starts
column5: only one of them a win . 	 • Figure this : Ordonez raised his major league - leading average to .359 . 	 • Quotable : " He did n't go up there trying to pull it . He stayed on the ball and boom -- nice stroke
column7: end of the game . " -- Tigers manager Jim Leyland on Ordonez 	 -- ESPN.com news services 	 Tigers 5
column8: Blue Jays 4 	 DETROIT ( AP ) -- Fans chanted " M - V - P ! " when Magglio Ordonez came to the plate in the bottom of the ninth Monday night . 	 Once again
column9: he delivered . 	 Ordonez hit a two - run single with two outs in the ninth inning
column10: capping a four - run rally that lifted the Detroit Tigers over the Toronto Blue Jays 5 - 4 . 	 The Tigers moved within 3½ games of idle New York in the AL wild - card race . 	 " It was a great win
column11: " Detroit manager Jim Leyland said . " We kept working at it and got the right guy up at the right time . " 	 The soft - spoken Ordonez ducked out of the clubhouse without talking to reporters . 	 Toronto ace Roy Halladay was one out away from his eighth complete game when he gave up singles to Sean Casey and Brandon Inge . After manager John Gibbons pulled the durable right - hander for Casey Janssen
column12: Curtis Granderson hit a two - run single to make it 4 - 3 . 	 Placido Polanco followed with a single and Gary Sheffield walked to load the bases . Ordonez delivered his fourth hit of the game
column13: an opposite - field liner to right . 	 " He did n't go up there trying to pull it
column14: " Leyland said . " He stayed on the ball and boom -- nice stroke
column16: end of the game . " 	 Polanco slid in ahead of Gregg Zaun 's tag to seal the comeback . 	 " That 's what makes him so tough to pitch to
column17: " Toronto manager John Gibbons said of Ordonez . " He uses the whole field . " 	 The Tigers won for the fourth time in five games . Yorman Bazardo ( 1 - 1 )
column18: making his seventh appearance this season
column19: worked the ninth for his first career win . 	 Halladay gave up three runs and 11 hits in 8 2/3 innings
column20: but missed out on a chance to improve to 12 - 2 against the Tigers . He has lasted at least eight innings in his last six starts
column21: yet only one of them a win . 	 Trailing 2 - 0 in the sixth
column22: Ordonez hit his major league - leading 48th double and scored on Mike Rabelo 's groundout . Halladay followed that by surrendering a two - out double to Timo Perez
column23: but struck out Casey to end the threat . 	 The Blue Jays added two more in the eighth on Zaun 's two - out single
column24: but Halladay and Janssen ( 2 - 3 ) could not hold the lead . 	 " There was no fatigue
column26: " Janssen said . " I needed to get an out and I just did n't do it . " 	 Ordonez
column27: likely the only challenger to the Yankees ' Alex Rodriguez for the AL MVP award
column28: raise his major league - leading average to .359 . He tied a career high with four hits
column29: and has a career - best 193 hits this season . 	 Kenny Rogers
column30: making his second start since returning from the disabled list with a sore elbow
column31: gave up nine hits and two runs in 6 1/3 innings . He has not won since July 4
column32: a span of five starts . 	 Reed Johnson tripled off Rogers in the first and came home on Alex Rios ' sacrifice fly . Frank Thomas scored in the fourth on Lyle Overbay 's single . 	 Blue Jays third baseman Troy Glaus left the game during the second inning after aggravating a nagging left foot injury that landed him on the disabled list in April . 	 Detroit catcher Ivan Rodriguez departed in the top of the third after experiencing dizziness . Leyland did not discuss his condition after the game . 	 Tigers right - hander Joel Zumaya relieved Rogers and threw 1 1/3 innings before leaving the game in the eighth with a pulled nail on his right index finger . He 's day - to - day . 	 Game notes 	  An MRI exam showed no structural damage to Detroit RHP Jeremy Bonderman 's right elbow
column33: but Leyland said it 's unlikely he will pitch again this season . ... Overbay broke an 0 - for-20 skid with his RBI single . ... Monday 's crowd of 35
column34: 689 set Detroit 's season home attendance record at 2

column3: Rockies 5 ( 10 innings ) 	 PHILADELPHIA ( AP ) -- Pat Burrell 's second - half surge has Philadelphia on the brink of the wild - card lead . More games like this one and the Phillies just might get there . 	 Ryan Howard doubled home the winning run in the 10th inning after Burrell tied the game with a dramatic homer in the seventh
column4: leading the Phillies to a 6 - 5 victory over the Colorado Rockies on Monday night . 	 " We 've got to keep winning and playing hard
column5: " Burrell said . 	 While Burrell knew his home run was gone from the moment it left his bat
column6: Yorvit Torrealba 's shot left too much doubt about clearing the fence in the fourth . The Rockies ' catcher ended up with a controversial ground - rule double
column7: allowing Burrell 's swing to set up another thrilling win for the Phillies . 	 Chase Utley led off the 10th with a single off Taylor Buchholz ( 6 - 5 )
column8: the seventh pitcher for Colorado . After Burrell struck out
column9: Howard lined a double to left
column10: and the speedy Utley hustled all the way around for the winning run as the Phillies continue to gain ground in their playoff push . 	 The Rockies and Phillies are jostling in the NL wild - card standings
column11: and Philadelphia took the first game of the four - game series to close within 1½ games of the idle wild card - leading Padres . The Rockies are 3½ games back . 	 " I think we 've kind of shifted our attention away from the [ NL East - leading ] Mets
column12: " Burrell said . " I think six games at this point is too much . So we had to regroup . Sometimes that 's hard . " 	 Brett Myers ( 4 - 6 ) pitched a scoreless ninth and 10th
column13: leaving a runner stranded on third in the 10th . 	 Troy Tulowitzki set an NL rookie record for homers by a shortstop and Matt Holliday also went deep for Colorado . Howard hit his 38th homer for the Phillies . 	 The game might not have gone extras if not for the call in the fourth . 	 With two outs and the bases loaded
column14: Torrealba hit a shot the opposite way to right . A fan reached for the ball and it fell back onto the field
column15: though replays were inconclusive whether it went over the fence . Torrealba had a ground - rule double on fan interference
column16: giving the Rockies a 2 - 1 lead . 	 Colorado manager Clint Hurdle argued for several minutes on the infield grass with first base umpire Mike DiMuro . All four umps briefly conferred
column17: but the call stood . It turned out to cost the Rockies two runs once pitcher Ubaldo Jimenez was retired to end the inning . 	 " I do n't think they got the call right
column18: " Hurdle said . " It 's a hard call . It took away two runs . " 	 Phillies manager Charlie Manuel said he saw a fan reach over the fence to catch the ball . 	 Jimenez -- who gave up four hits
column20: struck out three -- had his fastball humming in the triple digits and shut down Philadelphia 's potent lineup through six innings . But the Rockies ' bullpen totally collapsed in the seventh and earned him a tough no - decision . 	 Jimmy Rollins hit a two - out single off LaTroy Hawkins and stole second and third . The left - handed Jeremy Affeldt walked Utley and Hurdle brought in right - hander Jorge Julio to face the streaking Burrell
column21: who has raised his average from .201 in July to .266 after he went 2 - for-5 . 	 Once the most booed athlete in Philadelphia in any sport this year
column22: Burrell has turned his season and the fan reaction around . He hit a 2 - 0 fastball from Julio deep into the left - field seats for his 28th homer
column23: tying the game at 5 and sending the crowd into a frenzy . 	 " I knew if I just stayed with it and kept going
column26: it 's just maintaining what I 'm doing and keep going . " 	 Added a chuckling Manuel : " I remember when you guys were hollering for me to bench him . He 's got 90 RBIs and come a long way . " 	 Kyle Lohse nearly matched Jimenez with six solid innings . He gave up three runs and struck out five -- two when the Rockies threatened with two on and one out in the fifth . 	 Tulowitzki 's 20th homer in the fifth made it 3 - 1
column27: breaking the NL record for homers by a rookie shortstop that was set by Ernie Banks in 1954 . 	 After the Phillies ' bullpen threw 8 2/3 innings of shutout ball the last two games against Florida

column29: in his first full season with the Phillies

column4: Brewers 0 	 PITTSBURGH ( AP ) -- The Pittsburgh Pirates are in the middle of the NL Central race despite being two losses from a 15th consecutive losing season . They 're not close to first place
column5: but they keep beating the teams fighting for it . 	 Tony Armas pitched six sharp innings a day after Milwaukee hit six home runs
column6: and Nate McLouth 's two - run homer carried Pittsburgh to another home - field victory over the Brewers
column8: its fourth in five games in Pittsburgh this season
column9: dropped the Brewers back into a first - place tie in the NL Central with the Chicago Cubs
column10: who beat St. Louis 12 - 3 earlier Monday . The Cubs had fallen a game back by losing two of three in Pittsburgh over the weekend . 	 Armas and relievers Franquelis Osoria and Romulo Sanchez combined on the four - hitter
column11: blanking a team that broke loose at Cincinnati on Sunday with eight extra - base hits in a 10 - 5 victory . 	 " That 's how it goes like that
column12: " Brewers manager Ned Yost said when asked how his team could n't advance a runner past second after scoring 10 runs the day before . " He located his pitches very well
column14: kept the ball down and was on the attack early in the count . " 	 Armas ( 4 - 5 )
column16: allowed three singles in shutting down the Brewers for his fourth victory in five career decisions against them . He has won four of his last six overall after going 0 - 3 during the first half of the season . 	 " You 're seeing a very confident pitcher right now and a pitcher who 's very comfortable with his pitches
column17: " Pirates manager Jim Tracy said . " He kept them off stride . They did n't get too many good swings against him . " 	 The Brewers had won eight of 11 but
column19: could n't find a way to win in Pittsburgh -- they have lost 41 of 60 there since PNC Park opened in 2001
column20: even though the Pirates have yet to have a winning season during that time . 	 There really is a home - field advantage when these teams play . The Brewers are 8 - 1 at home against the Pirates this season but have lost 13 of their last 17 and four straight in Pittsburgh . 	 Prince Fielder said the Brewers must learn to win close games
column22: and not count on scoring a lot of runs every day . Milwaukee scored seven or more runs in five of its first eight games this month . 	 " We 've got to bear down and go after guys because sometimes it 's going to be like that
column23: " Fielder said . " If we 're not going to score
column24: sometimes we 've at least got to battle to keep it close . " 	 Asked if the Pirates deserve some credit for playing the contenders tough
column27: I do n't care about credit . We 've got to win . " 	 The top three hitters in Milwaukee 's lineup went 0 - for-12 after getting seven hits and seven RBIs Sunday . Rickie Weeks
column28: J.J. Hardy and Ryan Braun were the top three Sunday
column30: Gabe Gross and Braun on Monday . 	 Carlos Villanueva ( 7 - 4 )
column31: making only his third start this season
column32: shut out Pittsburgh until rookie Nyjer Morgan singled in the fifth and scored on McLouth 's 12th homer . McLouth
column33: playing left field because Jason Bay remains out with a sore right knee
column34: had three hits and scored three runs . 	 Morgan also made his second excellent catch in as many days in center field
column35: leaping high against the wall to grab Fielder 's drive to start the seventh . The ball would not have left the park if Morgan had n't caught it
column36: but Fielder likely would have had a double . 	 In the sixth

column38: with two runs scoring . Phelps was credited with one RBI . 	 " That 's huge right there
column40: " Yost said . " This time of the year

column43: but has driven in a combined 116 runs with four teams while advancing through every level of the Pirates ' farm system since April . He is hitting .313 with Pittsburgh . Morgan
column44: who missed half the season with a thumb injury
